TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit MutualInformationFeatureSelectorStaticExtensions extends System.Object

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<bool> SelectFeaturesBasedOnMutualInformation (this Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<bool> input, Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<bool> labelColumn, int slotsInOutput = 1000, int numBins = 256);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector`1<bool> SelectFeaturesBasedOnMutualInformation(class Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector`1<bool> input, class Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar`1<bool> labelColumn, int32 slotsInOutput, int32 numBins) cil managed

<Extension()> Public Function SelectFeaturesBasedOnMutualInformation (input As Vector(Of Boolean), labelColumn As Scalar(Of Boolean), Optional slotsInOutput As Integer = 1000, Optional numBins As Integer = 256) As Vector(Of Boolean)
static member SelectFeaturesBasedOnMutualInformation : Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<bool> * Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<bool> * int * int -> Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<bool>

Docs.param: Name of the input column.
Name of the column to use for labels.
The maximum number of slots to preserve in the output. The number of slots to preserve is taken across all input columns.
Max number of bins used to approximate mutual information between each input column and the label column. Power of 2 recommended.
Docs.summary: Selects the top k slots across all specified columns ordered by their mutual information with the label column.

remarks.para: The mutual information of two random variables X and Y is a measure of the mutual dependence between the variables. Formally, the mutual information can be written as:

where the expectation is taken over the joint distribution of X and Y. Here p(x,y) is the joint probability density function of X and Y, p(x) and p(y) are the marginal probability density functions of X and Y respectively. In general, a higher mutual information between the dependent variable (or label) and an independent variable (or feature) means that the label has higher mutual dependence over that feature. It keeps the top SlotsInOutput features with the largest mutual information with the label.
